title: LeaverBuster in Ai games
body: So today I got leaver buster for lagging out in a co-op vs Ai game. i still was able to join back but i still was lagging but while ingame i was trying to fix my setting so a stood still for a while trying to fix my lag and i got the Leaverbuster system msg, after the game was over (We won obviously) i now have to play 5 low priority queue games . To me i believe that Low Priority queue shouldn't even be in Co-op vs Ai like that are the odds of you losing to Ai's with one person afk most people use it for practice when they purchase a new champ and they don't want to go to norms and fail. Do you guys think it's fair ?

replies.body: AI and premade 5s should be exempt from leaverbuster. Why? Because if someone disconnects from a bot game, the game shuts off a bot as well. Thus leaving the game still fair. And in a premade 5, it should be up to the team to punish you, not Riot.

This is the world we live in now, where trash like TraakSC can post comments like that. Where a system looks at rules and guidelines in a black and white manner instead of the actual context of a situation.

Sorry about what happened Captain Shell, atleast its only 5 games.
I am not sure what you are confused about. The context is that the OP admitted he went AFK and was punished for it.

I have mixed feelings about leaverbuster applying to ai games and I have a hard time separating my bias because I do consider them to be completely unimportant.

Leaving is an issue that is bigger than the specific incidents. Punishing leavers is about reinforcing the idea that its not ok to leave and measuring things like disconnect rate that are both going to carry over to other modes when you play them. On the other hand, leaving doesn't have near the same impact on an AI game since they are both much easier and an opponent bot leaves too. So a leave creates a 4v4 rather than a 4v5.

I think its also important to point out that leaverbuster doesn't hand out punishments for a single leave. You weren't punished for leaving 1 coop game. You were punished for having an unacceptable leave rate across all games. You should have at least had the warning that you had to type "I agree" for your first leave and probably at least 1 more leave before this.

IIRC a week after Leaverbuster change there were servers problems so big, that half of the people playing that day had to type "I agree", even if it was 100% game's fault.

On the other hand:
>You were punished for having an unacceptable leave rate across all games. 

This is bullshit. You might not notice the first AFK and the second is outright punished. You don't need to AFK 10 times in a row. Just two.
So you admit you went AFK after reconnecting and you are mad for being punished for it? Okay.
I wont say mad more like annoyed due to the game mode and it's not like I didn't help my team I got 3 kills
Leavebuster doesn't care if you have 50 kills. If you AFK, you get flagged. It isn't rocket science.
But it was a bot game and again what are the chances of losing
It is still a game with other players. Some people only play bot games. Some newbs actually lose to bot games. Why not just create a custom game with bots so you can come and go as you please?

Because I was practicing Wukong so I wouldn't feed when I try him in normals also if you only play ai what is the point  of playing league then. you must not have read thoroughly please read it again.

My girlfriend only plays bots because she doesn't like the pressure of playing against other people but likes playing games with me. To be clear I'm not weighing in on the issues you had with leave buster, just saying that the other person you were talking to did have a valid point when he said some people only play bots.

Well I can see why she doesn't like the pressure of playing with other people because this community is Toxic af and if she makes a little mistake  someone will end up raging at her for it .Most of the time they don't get punished for their actions other than a chat ban for 5 games and that doesn't really solve anything. I believe that Everyone who plays League has been toxic at least once or twice either because they are having a bad day and people are making it worse by trolling  or their client is crashing constantly  and they can't connect to any games and its frustrating {{champion:32}} {{item:3070}} .

You don't seem to understand that leaverbuster is there for people who WILLINGLY afk from games, or "rage quit". Is that the rocket science part that you don't seem to be getting?

The game does **not** differentiate between AFK  and lagging out. Their servers have been so bad lately, on 3 different games i've had to close my game out and load back in because i'm stuck there with an "attempting to reconnect" screen for 3 minutes that won't go away. three. games. in 2 days. Yet, **my** internet is fine.

riot doesn't account for things that are their fault. To actually leave a game you have to click "YES, i want to leave game" or a computer should be able to easily pick up lag and what not. It's not hard to do, but riot doesn't care to do it because this is the new "punish everything" system riot wants.

It's not hard to do, but riot doesn't care to do it because this is the new "punish everything" system riot wants.

It is not ONLY for people who willingly afk or rage quit. Leaverbuster is just as much about preventing people who have regular connection/computer issues.

If leaves only counted after exiting and confirming the exit then leaverbuster might as well not exist. People would just pull the plug on their router or disable their wifi and you would never get caught.
